pull.title: [0.17] Bugfix: Correctly calculate balances when min_conf is used, and for getbalance("*")
pull.body: 0.17 backport of #14602, but with named-arg account="*" compatibility

events.message: Wallet: Add trusted_only flag to GetBalance
Bugfix: RPC/Wallet: Restore getbalance("*") behaviour (include untrusted coins), while updating the API to accept a boolean as well
Bugfix: Wallet: When getting balance w/ min_conf, include UTXOs that were spent more recently
lint: Remove incorrect check that all arguments are string or not
RPC/Wallet: Include "account" named arg alias for getbalance compatibility

events.body:
I have the same comment for this PR as for the PR to master: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14602#pullrequestreview-179314689

This PR needs a few things before I'd consider it ready for merge:

- A rationale for why we'd want to provide this 'feature'. Summing up untrusted coins into a 'balance' can lead to very confusing results, such as negative balances and double-counting conflicting transactions. An uninformed user could see money 'disappear' or be tricked into thinking they've received money which they haven't.
- Full documentation of the usage. I removed `getbalance *` here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12953/files#diff-df7d84ff2f53fcb2a0dc15a3a51e55ceL822 because the option had been marked as deprecated. If we want to support this usage, then it should be properly documented, with appropriate warnings and caveats.
- Full test coverage, so this doesn't get regressed again. I wrote some tests here: https://github.com/jnewbery/bitcoin/tree/untrusted_balance in the course of reviewing this PR.
- Not [gratuitously breaking bitcoin-cli because you don't happen to use it](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14602#discussion_r235654273).

Also for this backport:

- Not deleting linters because they fail on your branch(!)
The linter is broken by design.
